climbs.name: Way Beyond the Fond Old River

content.description: Lots of holds through the first 7 feet or so. Start with toes on the small holds just above ground level and match on a small hold near waist level. Move upwards to a couple of ledges, then to a few slopey holds on the right side, then to a shallow finger pocket. Top out to finish.
content.location: One of the further boulders in from the approach trail. Problem faces the water.

content.description: Start in the center of the face with hands at mid height, feet on low crimp intrusions. Reach up for a good edge, match, reset feet on higher crimps, grab the top, top out. Beware - the crimps you choose to stand on may break off when you make your move for the top - mine did!
content.location: On the boulder face opposite (further upstream) of Way Beyond the Fond Old River.

content.description: Start with right hand on high crimp next to a pocket, left heel in a good dish and left hand on fairly solid crimp near the heel. Move up on middle/right of boulder and top out just above good scale.
content.location: Medium sized boulder just to the left of the Do It For Dale boulder.

content.description: A straight run up a slab on the side of "Way Beyond the Fond Old River"

Somewhat of a traverse problem. Start on the left side of the boulder. Left heel hook on a small ledge with hands on a pair of crimps/ledges. Walk hands across the ledges and and flip your legs around to a right heel hook on a slopey ledge. Reach up to a sharp crimp, mantle to the top side, and match at the pair of finger pockets to finish. Keep feet up on the smooth vertical ledge underneath. This problem becomes a V1 or so if you use the lowest rock ledge for your feet through the overhanging section.
content.location: Approximately in the middle of the boulder area.

content.description: Start under the roof inside the cave, left of chalked up edge inside cave. Reach up left to good pocket, then work way up on crimps through water groove and top out.
content.location: Facing away from river, this route is 10 feet from the right side of the rightmost boulder in the grouping.

content.description: Straight up the side of the boulder making use of the corner. Top out to finish.
content.location: Middle of the boulder area. Problem faces "Way Beyond the Fond Old River"

content.description: Directly beside "Hank." Runs straight up the center of the boulder. Top out to finish.
content.location: Directly beside "Hank." Center of the boulder area.

content.description: Start at a small, low scoop feature on the left end of the boulder. Squat start with hands on a large ledge. Pull up to gain a small left facing flake.  Climb this to an easy top out.
content.location: Continue down the riverside trail about 50 feet past Black Crimp Traverse.  Pass under a dirty prow with a muddy base.  There is another boulder past the prow.  The problems are uphill on the far (upstream) side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start at the right end between the prow and the small tree. Climb up and left keeping to solid rock.  Top out just to the right of the tree.
content.protection: Pad.  A spotter would be helpful to prevent you from tumbling downhill.
content.location: Continue down the riverside trail about 50 feet past Black Crimp Traverse.  Pass under a dirty prow with a muddy base.  There is another boulder past the prow.  The problems are uphill on the far (upstream) side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start immediately to the left of the tree. Head Straight up on good holds and top out.
content.location: Continue down the riverside trail about 50 feet past Black Crimp Traverse.  Pass under a dirty prow with a muddy base.  There is another boulder past the prow.  The problems are uphill on the far (upstream) side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start below the overhang. Move up through an undercling to some decent crimps then over to the large jug. Top out with the same finish as Break Left Instead.
content.location: Far left side of the boulder, just before the obvious crack seam in the lower shelf.

content.description: Squat start beneath the overhang. Reach out and up to a crimp. Swing out from under the overhang and grab a finger pocket. Match on a decent ledge to the right and follow the big crack up. Top out to finish.
content.location: from the approach trail, this will be the first boulder you encounter.

content.description: Same start as Do it for Dale and Killer Beas. Start on crumbly pinch under overhang and make a blind reachy move to a decent pocket for left hand. Work up and left, until you can make a big move left (4-5 feet) to a good jug. The remainder of the route finishes straight up from this jug, requiring pasting feet on some pretty bad feet and muscling up the seam to an easy top out.
content.protection: 1-2 pads, spotter wouldnt hurt for topout.
content.location: Same boulder as Do it for Dale and Killer Beas, the farthest right boulder in the grouping when viewed with back to river.

content.description: Crimpy traverse along the same face as the Unknown V1. Start on chalked up horn on left arête and top out just before right arête above decent pinch.
content.location: To the left of the Squidward’s Nose boulder. Same as the Unknown V1 boulder.

content.description: Starts with a solid heel hook at the left side of a boulder with occasional hard, black, and incredibly painful crimps. Work rightwards on these crimps with no good feet for about 5 feet until reaching the arete, then cruise up the arete to an easy topout.
content.location: This route is on the leftmost side of the boulder directly to the left of Squidward's Nose and Way Beyond.. when viewed with back to river. Start around the corner along the trail, out of view of Squidward's Nose boulder.

content.description: A small area of climbable boulders just off the greenway trail head at the intersection of Thompson and Broad in Murfreesboro. This is regularly climbed, but not documented. Please add more info if you have any to contribute.
